result.execSummary:
The defendant Lazarick L Spade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: BOTH COUNTS: Pay the DNA and DV surcharges by 01-13-17 or a civil judgment will be entered. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: EACH OTHER AS TO BOTH COUNTS; and CONCURRENT to any other sentence
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lazarick L Spade

records.addlTxt: Bail refund packet.  vp

ADDRESS INFO for Lazarick L Spade
Current: 4739 N 77th Ct., Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 04-26-2017)
Prior: 1821A W Arthur Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53215 United States

State complied with victim notification. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
Court ordered defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 2 and concurrent to any other sentence.

AS TO COUNT 2 AMENDED
Court ordered defendant to 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 1 and concurrent to any other sentence.

Court ordered defendant to pay the DNA and DV surcharges by 1/13/2017 or a civil judgment will be entered.

Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

Filed, Five letters to the Court provided by defense.

Defendant Lazarick L Spade in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant Lazarick L Spade in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered Habitual Criminality Repeater Enhancer DISMISSED. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
Order to Produce from RCI,  Filed

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant Lazarick L Spade not in court, in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant NOT produced. Court ordered case remain set for Jury Trial on 7/13/2016 with resolution being heard on that day. Case adjourned to branch 24.
Order to Produce from Racine Correctional.
Per defense request, case is set for Plea and Sentencing on 7/8/2016 at 8:30 am. Parties notified.
Received and filed.
Received and filed.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered charge amended to misdemeanor battery, habitual criminality repeater, domestic abuse assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.62(1)(a), 973.055(1) a Class A misdemeanor.

Defendant Lazarick L Spade in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant Lazarick L Spade in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. State placed final offer on the record. Offer to remain open until 6/15/16. Defense counsel to file all documents by close of day. Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect. Case set for Jury Trial on 7/13/16. Case adjourned to Branch 24.
Dodge Correctional.

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant Lazarick L Spade not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant's appearance waived. Defense received discovery and an offer. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Scheduling Order signed and filed. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant Lazarick L Spade not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Scheduling Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lazarick L Spade in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Lazarick L Spade in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Court VACATES Jury Trial date. Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Lazarick L Spade not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lazarick L Spade in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Lazarick L Spade in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Ryan Dombeck. Exhibit 1 received. Exhibit list received and filed. State rests. Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TS dob 7/21/82

Defendant Lazarick L Spade in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Lazarick L Spade in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
